The Gallup report from January 23: 2019, which states that the uninsured rate in the US has risen to a four-year high.
The Georgetown University Health Policy: s updated CBO estimates from April 25, 2019, which indicate that the number of uninsured Americans increased by 1.4 million between 2016 and 2018.
The CDC: s report from May 9, 2019, which states that 1.1 million more Americans lost health insurance coverage in 2018.
The Los Angeles Times report from Januar: 2019, which claims that the uninsured rate under Trump has surged to the highest level since Obamacare began.
